page.syntax: Result_Flag as L = create_table(C filename ,C field_list )

argument.name: filename
argument.description: The file name of the .DBF file to create.

argument.name: field_list
argument.description: A CR-LF delimited list of field names in the format: Fieldname, type, width, decimal_places The field types, the single character codes used to represent them, and the valid parameters associated with them are:

item.name: Numeric
item.description: "N" Fieldname, Field Type, Width , Decimal Width

page.description: Create a new table using a CR-LF delimited list of field names
page.discussion: CREATE_TABLE() is a high level Xbasic function to create a new table. This function is easier to use than the low level, TABLE.CREATE_BEGIN(), TABLE.FIELD_ADD(), and TABLE.CREATE_END()methods. See TABLE.CREATE_BEGIN()for a list of valid field type codes.

section.title: Example
section.example: fields = <<%a% fname,c,20 lname,c,20 dob,d notes,m %a% create_table("c:\data\newtable.dbf", fields)
